This established location has become increasingly popular with international buyers seeking authentic Spanish living without sacrificing modern conveniences. Polop offers a perfect blend of traditional charm and contemporary amenities, with excellent transport connections, proximity to world-class golf courses, and access to multiple Blue Flag beaches. The region benefits from a Mediterranean climate, reliable infrastructure, and a cost of living significantly lower than northern Europe, making it an attractive investment hub for property buyers across Europe.

faqs.question: Can foreigners buy property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can freely purchase property in Spain without residency restrictions. Most international buyers require a Spanish tax identification number (NIE) and should utilize experienced legal advisors familiar with foreign purchase procedures. Property ownership rights are fully protected under Spanish law.

faqs.question: What are the costs of buying property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Beyond the purchase price, typical costs include transfer tax (6-10%), legal fees (0.5-1%), property registration (0.1%), and notary fees (0.5-1%). Annual property taxes are approximately 0.4-1.1% of cadastral value. Our advisors provide comprehensive cost breakdowns throughout the purchase process.
